item.title: Team Leader/ SME Development Expert (Category I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term Evaluation of the ‘Integrated Support to Poverty and Inequality Reduction through Enterprise Development’ (INSPIRED)

The main objective of the Mid-Term Evaluation is to review the project progress, under each of the Components, to check the achievements against the expected results and set of activities. The Evaluation will provide a clear and concise opinion as to how the project has progressed including recommendations regarding the course of actions to be taken until the end of implementation.

In this respect the mission will assess the relevance, efficiency, effectiveness, impact and sustainability of each of the Components of the entire INSPIRED Programme related to the stated purpose and results. It will identify weaknesses and challenges, whilst proposing measures and recommendations to tackle them, including recommendations for any required change/modification to the project scope in order to support effective implementation and delivery of as sustainable benefit stream.

Team Leader/ SME Development Expert (Category I)

  • Master’s Degree in Economics/Business Management or other relevant subjects or in absence of diploma, equivalent professional experience of at least 15 years, in SME related issues: Enterprise policy, SME support programmes (at national, regional and local levels), SME Development Strategy and Policy, SME promotion (financial and non-financial support schemes, investment support, training and networking
  • Good understanding and knowledge of private sector development issues in developing countries, preferably in South Asia.
  • Familiarity with EC project evaluation procedures and related documentation is mandatory; previous experience in monitoring and evaluation is a must
  • Fluency in English both written and oral.
  • Excellent reporting and presentation skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills (communication, interviewing, analytical, neutral and objective attitude)
  • Proficiency in standard computer technology packages (word, excel, internet)
  • A minimum of 12 years professional experience in SME development and in particular in development SME policies including financial and non-financial support measures, clustering, networking, etc. with actions implemented by SME agencies or governments.
  • Minimum of 8 years of professional experience in the management and/or participation in projects involving technical aspects, such as: business development services, economic planning, SME sector development, investment facilitation, institutional capacity development, provision of economic-related capacity building to public authorities. Experience in the provision of such assistance to countries of South Asia would be an advantage.
  • Solid experience in evaluating technical assistance projects in developing countries
  • Management and/or participation in projects involving international teams of experts of different technical backgrounds
  • Proven knowledge of European Union project management procedures and financial regulations, preferably through management and participation in EU-funded technical assistance projects would be an advantage
  • Experience of dealing at a senior level with governmental or private sector institutions; experience in working in a complex structure of government ministries and agencies, and private sector organisations.

item.title: Deputy Team Leader, Justice Services and Stability for Development (JSS4D), Papua New Guinea
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Please note that there are four deputy team leader positions relating to Community Safety, Family and Sexual Violence, Law and Justice Services and Anti-Corruption. These positions may be shared where possible.

Position Description:

The Deputy Team Leader shall support the Team Leader to achieve the outcomes of the Program. They will primarily be responsible for managing activities in their component areas. They may also be required to provide technical input into other aspects of the program.

ARF Level: D3

Responsibilities:

  • Support in the management and coordination in the achievement of the Program objectives.
  • Working in a collaborative and coordinated manner with relevant agency-advisers, support sector agencies, coordinating bodies and other partners, including at the sub-national and community level, to build capacity to implement the JSS4D program;
  • Encourage and support efforts to improve coordination, coherence and partnerships among sector stakeholders, and to build mutual understanding and engagement with central agencies, at sub-national levels and within communities;
  • Support mechanisms to address service delivery challenges and overarching policy issues such as community and subnational engagement, gender equality and restorative justice;
  • Support law and justice sector managers and staff to participate effectively in sector coordination mechanisms and other forums;
  • Work proactively, in a collaborative manner with other GoA-funded programs, as well as other donors, to enable cross-program learning and coordination, and to ensure effective harmonisation of assistance to the law and justice sector; and
  • Integrate principles of gender equality and gender mainstreaming into capacity building approaches.
  • Ensure quality assurance principles guide the timely preparation and submission of required briefings and reports.

Skills and experience:

  • Tertiary qualifications in a relevant field and / or significant experience.
  • Demonstrated understanding of the role and functions of the justice system and its agencies in a modern democracy.
  • Demonstrated understanding of the range of capacity building approaches and their applicability to different contexts and needs, and commitment to principles of gender equality and gender mainstreaming.
  • Substantial knowledge, skills and experience in the adviser’s designated area of expertise and an understanding of its importance in effecting sustainable organisational change.
  • Experience in a dynamic public sector or other major organisational environment, in particular politically sensitive environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to develop constructive working relationships with a range of government, private sector and community stakeholders.
  • High level policy and analytical skills.
  • High level interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Experience in working successfully in a cross-cultural, multi-lingual environment, particularly in the Pacific would be an advantage.

How to apply: Please send your CV by email to Sarah_Owen@dai.com.

Please note that due to high volumes of applications, we cannot guarantee to respond to each applicant.

Deadline for Application: 27th April 2015 (Recruitment will close once suitable candidates have been identified)
